Comments_List: We developed upon the skills learned in L1 Italian. I feel like I have a good grip on the language now.
I improved my Italian skills greatly. It's cool to see how much better I am now than when I was at the beginning of the semester.
Full mastery of the grammar of the Italian language. Improves upon speaking skills through immersion.
A further grasp of the italian language.
I like the small class sizes and all of the personal feedback. However, I would have liked it if the tests were spaced farther apart.
The course is very fast paced. You will learn a lot, however it will be challenging.

It is strong because it is a small and supportive learning environment, however I think it could be stronger if there was more applied and immersive exercises rather than just memorizing and learning in class.
If you're looking to start a new language, this is a great one to choose. It's not extremely popular, but you bond with others in the class, and the faculty in the department is pretty great too.
Yes, the Italian language is beautiful and very fun to learn.
Yes, italian is the best language to take at Yale in my opinion. It is fun and the teachers are amazing.
